programme.title: Mr. Ricco
programme.desc: A San Francisco lawyer (Dean Martin) helps his client (Thalmus Rasulala) beat a murder rap marked by racial overtones.

programme.title: Uptown Saturday Night
programme.desc: Blue-collar buddies (Sidney Poitier, Bill Cosby) search the underworld for a winning lottery ticket lost in a nightclub holdup.

programme.title: Let's Do It Again
programme.desc: Two lodge brothers (Sidney Poitier, Bill Cosby) fix a fight and bilk mobsters by hypnotizing a bony boxer (Jimmie Walker).

programme.title: A Piece of the Action
programme.desc: Two con men (Sidney Poitier, Bill Cosby) are persuaded by a retired policeman (James Earl Jones) to volunteer their services to a ghetto youth center.

programme.title: Crazy Mama
programme.desc: An evicted mother (Ann Sothern) and daughter (Cloris Leachman) lead a cross-country 1950s crime spree.

programme.title: Mean Johnny Barrows
programme.desc: A Vietnam veteran (Fred Williamson) gets caught in a mob war with a couple of double-crossers (Jenny Sherman, Roddy McDowall).

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Featured guest Bill Withers sings hit single, "Ain't No Sunshine" and other selections from his album, "Just As I Am"; young poetess Mae Jackson reads from her own works.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Former heavyweight boxing champion Muhammad Ali; South African born singer Miriam Makeba; the Delfonics; guest-host Nikki Giovanni opens with her Kidnap Poem.

programme.title: Soul!
programme.desc: Singer Jerry Butler headlines with his back-up group, Peaches; highlights of their numbers are "Make It Easy on Yourself" and "Brand New Me."

programme.title: Soul!
programme.sub-title: Lee Morgan; Horace Silver; Bobbi Humphrey
programme.desc: Jazz lineup features pianist Horace Silver at the electric keyboard, Lee Morgan on trumpet and 22-year old Bobbi Humphrey playing the flute; vocalists Andy and Salome Bey.

programme.title: Jazz Session at the Blue Note With Chaka Khan
programme.sub-title: Jazz Session at the Blue Note With Chaka Khan
programme.desc: Recorded in 1993 at the Blue Note Jazz Club in New York City, this performance by Chaka Khan features a number of songs closely associated with jazz.

programme.title: Bone: A Bad Day In Beverly Hills
programme.desc: A potential rapist (Yaphet Kotto) enters a Beverly Hills home and sends the husband (Andrew Duggan) to the bank while he stays with the wife (Joyce Van Patten).

programme.title: Cleopatra Jones
programme.desc: Federal agent Jones (Tamara Dobson) tries to rescue her framed boyfriend (Bernie Casey) from a drug-queen pervert known as Mommy (Shelley Winters).

programme.title: The Slams
programme.desc: Rival prison factions surround a Los Angeles convict (Jim Brown) who has $1.5 million stashed on the outside.

programme.title: Black Samson
programme.desc: A nightclub owner (Rockne Tarkington) with a pet lion rids his neighborhood of a white mobster (William Smith).

programme.title: Solomon King
programme.desc: A man (Sal Watts) declares war on the Arabs who murdered his ex-lover.
